## New Theory

### <del>Culture</del> Communication-based:

--

* Listening: 
    + Propaganda &#8686;
    + Hypotheses:
        + Being <font color="red">more</font> familiar with the political institutions 
        + Align <font color="red">more</font> with the government
        + <font color="red">More</font> political trust
    
--
    
* Speaking: 
    + Activism &#8686;
    + Hypotheses:
        + <font color="red">More</font> interests and internal efficacy in politics
        + <font color="blue">Less</font> external efficacy
        + <font color="red">More</font> negative impression of the governmental officials.
    
---
    
* Relative
    + Suitability  &#8669; Conservativeness &#8686;
    + Hypotheses:
        + <font color="red">Better</font> self-evaluation 
        + <font color="red">More</font> confidence in the established regime
        + <font color="blue">Less</font> enthusiasm in changing it
        + <font color="red">More</font> political trust

---

class:large

## Research Design

* DV: 
    + Listening
        + Mainstream ideology: Political knowledge, social trust, official's competence
        + Policy attitudes: Family planning, migration
    + Speaking
        + Internal efficacy: Interest in politics, feeling politics complicated
        + External efficacy: Adopting suggestion, valuing attitude, awareness of opinions
        + Attitude to politicians: Selfish politicians
    + Relative
        + Self evaluation: Comparing to their generation
* IV:
    + Listening, speaking and relative proficiencies
    + Demographic, socioeconomic, regional controls
    + Post-stratification weights

--

* Source: Chinese General Social Survey 2010--15
